content:
Hi, I'm Tyson. I'm pretty new to Rust, but I've submitted a couple of beginner PRs against rustc, and I'm really enjoying learning about the compiler. I'd like to start contributing to efforts to lower barriers of adopting Rust. For starters, improving compile times is something I'd like to help out with.

I'm self-directing my work right now, but if there is anyone looking for help with a project, I'd be happy to get involved. :)
Hey Tyson! Always feel free to send a message in #t-compiler/help if you ever need help when hacking on the compiler :smile:

Tyson Nottingham said:

For starters, improving compile times is something I'd like to help out with.

you might be interested in #t-compiler/performance

Also, if you're interested, you might look at compiler memory usage. There are some good memory profilers, and you could take a look at how much memory rustc uses when compiling something huge like rustc_middle.
There's almost certainly more low hanging fruit.
I've been thinking of that very thing lately. I've had to pare down to -j 5 or risk irrecoverable thrashing. Definitely would like to not have to do that. :)
Yeah, compilers may unroll loops but during runtime very often size is speed.
